page.title: 20 LEGENDS /ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
page.content:
Woodnesborough - The village gets its name from the old Woden's Hill.An old legend is that the golden image of Woden,a pagan god,lies buried under the church or somewhere near it.
Black Pond Farm- We heard an old story that says a coach and horses was coming fast round a corner and overturned into the black pond, never to be seen again.
Parsonage Farm - In the attic of Parsonage Farm there is a shrieking skull.When the skull is moved,one room in the house screams.
-----------------||------------------- This data was collected and text written by by the pupils of CARTWRIGHT & KELSEY C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL Ash,Canterbury,Kent.
